alert.note: Alert for Osage (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 08 at 3:06PM CDT until June 10 at 2:11AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in St Louis MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following river in Missouri... Maries River near Westphalia. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maries River near Westphalia. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Friday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:47 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:47 PM CDT Wednesday was 10.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Thu Fri Sat Sun Mon Maries River Westphalia 10.0 10.2 3.6 2.5 2.0 2.0 2.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Rainfall heavier than forecast caused river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The National Weather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
